CatDescriptText: Thelonious Monk (1917-1982).  Monk is famous as the innovator of the jazz style known as BeBop.  He is also well known for his playing technique; his hands and fingers were flat and level with the piano.  In the early 40s, Thelonious Monk played for Harlem clubs like Minton's and Monroe's Uptown House.  He also played with Kenny Clarke, Dizzy Gillespie and Charlie Parker.
TitMainTitle: Thelonious Monk holding hands with woman wearing suit and name tag, possibly with "Jazz Priest" Father Norman O'Connor on right, at Pittsburgh Jazz Festival, Civic Arena
